ygData.subject: Re: Dawn on a New Beast Wars/Pascifists
ygData.msgSnippet: OOC: They ll be called Pascifists, but they won t be a couple of better us than them idiots.  They ll use weapons, just not lethal force.  They reconize that

OOC: They'll be called Pascifists, but they won't be a couple of 
better us than them idiots.  They'll use weapons, just not lethal 
force.  They reconize that an unconcious opponent is of little more 
danger than a dead one.  And you never know who might change sides 
later especially if you show them kindness.  Or atleast that's what 
they think.  Now do you want a char in their order or not?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Tankor <lordofdarkness11001@y...> wrote:
> 
>  i thought pacifist dont go to war
>   dewboy30816 <dewboy30816@y...> wrote: OOC: I decided to get the 
members of the Cybertronian Order of Monks 
> straight we should a few posts out in space.  I doubt the poll of 
who 
> should land first will affect that.
> 
> BIC:  Gracius (P.S. thanks for the name rAuq) floats a few feet 
from 
> the floor in the center of a room surrounded by his deciples.
> 
> Gracius:  Remember my children we are the messengers of peace.  
> Someday the Maximals and Predicons will have destroyed each other.  
> We must teach our children the ways of Peace (assuming bots have it 
> they have nothing against intercourse let alone girls joining up 
they 
> will make no destinction between Monk and Nun).  While fighting is 
> neccessary in both bio and techno life killing is not.  That is why 
> our code forbides the later, but not the former.  Do you have any 
> questions my children (in other words if you have a char post him 
> asking a question so I'll know he's there Pegatron's the only one I 
> remember being on board for sure other than Gracius himself).
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Blackknight slightly touched his auditive sensor, where his 
> internal 
> > comm unit was. He nodded.
> > 
> > Blackknight: Roger. I'll get some detector and look around.
> > 
> > He gets a detector, one looking for energy signatures, and 
managed 
> to 
> > get out.
> > 
> > Blackknight: Icedemon, Arcangel, I'm going to check around. See 
you 
> > both later!
> > 
> > He walks slowly towards the living quarters and activated his 
> scanner.
> > 
> > Blackknight: Anybody here?
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jonathan" <jhogan@r...> wrote:
> > > He slowly starts to move again. The legendary Autobot, who had 
> > descided to work on a Maximal ship, made his way to the bridge.
> > > 
> > > {Talos}
> > > Bridge
> > > 
> > > The maximal commander listened as the reports came in, the 
armory 
> he 
> > imagined must have looked like a battle hit it. Sighing he 
righted 
> > himself in his chair more fully turning towards the two bots that 
> had 
> > walked onto his bridge giving a nod of respect to Hot Rod, it had 
> been 
> > a relative honor to serve alongside one of the more key figures 
in 
> > their peoples histories.
> > > 
> > > The other seemed to imply he was a criminal of some sort, he 
> didn't 
> > really care in any case. "Armory is only shook up, but reports 
seem 
> to 
> > say the thrusters are off line and quite frankly scrap. We need 
to 
> get 
> > external sensors up and see just what kind of planet we've 
crashed 
> > ourselves on, once we can see where the slag we are we can go 
from 
> > there..."
> > > 
> > > Turning he regarded the 'criminal', "I don't know what in the 
> Matrix 
> > you're talking about. You appear to believe you're in trouble 
with 
> the 
> > law but at this point I don't give a slag what you've done. This 
> ship 
> > is in bad shape, we have a mission to complete and I don't have 
> time 
> > to assign personnel to guard you in a brig."
> > > 
> > >     Turning he looked the bot in the eye, "Help Hot Rod get our 
> > sensors up and running or report yourself to the CR chambers on 
> deck 
> > two if you're too injured to help. But if you plan on sticking 
> around 
> > you're gonna help us, now get to it."
> > > 
> > >     Swiveling in the chair he regarded the com, "Icedemon and 
> > Archangel get started on repairs on either the computers or Comm 
> > systems. BlackKnight check the ship for any more bots whose comms 
> > might be down, injuries to the CR chambers those not functioning, 
> as 
> > much as I hate to say it, we'll worry about later, priority on 
the 
> > operational first."
> > > 
> > > Turning back to look out the shattered window he silently hoped 
> > Megatron was as bad off as they were, if the predicons launched a 
> > pre-emptive strike he doubted the ship could take a beating after 
> the 
> > crash. Moving to the computers he began investigating the status 
of 
> > the frigates weapons and defense systems, they weren't priority 
one 
> at 
> > the moment but he wanted at least something to re-assure the crew 
> they 
> > weren't sitting blind and utterly defenseless.
